DataElement.preferredName: Patient Health Questionnaire - 9 Item Total Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The sum of all responses by an individual to the Patient Health Questionnaire (PHQ-9).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Health Questionnaire - 9 Item Total Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 9-item scale using each of the 9 DSM-IV criteria with self-reported frequency of "0" (not at all) to "3" (nearly every day). One of the most widely used instruments to assess depression, PHQ-9 scores of 5, 10, 15, and 20 represent mild, moderate, moderately severe, and severe depression, respectively._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized survey developed and published by Kurt Kroenke, Robert Spitzer and Janet Williams in 2001 in the Journal of General Internal Medicine which is used to measure the severity of an individual's depression symptoms. This instrument contains 9 items with a follow-up question that is not part of the scoring. Each item is rated on a scale of 0-3 with 0 being 'not at all' and 3 being 'nearly every day.'

Concepts.definition: A 9-item scale using each of the 9 DSM-IV criteria with self-reported frequency of "0" (not at all) to "3" (nearly every day). One of the most widely used instruments to assess depression, PHQ-9 scores of 5, 10, 15, and 20 represent mild, moderate, moderately severe, and severe depression, respectively.
